Posts.Content: Wow how insensitive can some people be! As someone else said you definitely find out who your friends are.. I had friends that I had no doubt would have been there for me as I had been for them but let me down, it makes you think about your future and who you want to be around..
Posts.Title: Fed up

Posts.Content: Hi mandi, I am on my 2nd chemo, yesterday I could have cried all day, today I feel better and hope I keep feeling better.. Make sure you get all the support you can be it friends family, the lovely people on here, if you have access to a Maggie's centre or cancer support group like I have in Scotland, not forgetting the nurses on the helpline.. It will get better.. Hugs
Posts.Title: Im New

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I have been told by my oncologist that I will lose my hair no matter what, she didn't duscuss cold cap at all.. Are there types of chemo that you will lose your hair in matter what or should I insist on the cold cap? Thanks for any advise Sharon
Posts.Title: Starting EC and advice on scalp cooling please!!!

Posts.Content: Hi I will beat this, first of all good luck for tomorrow, I am due to have my 2nd FEC on Friday, I would mirror what others have said, do what your body tells you, sleep when tired, eat what you want when you want, drink plenty of water. I am going into my 2nd one, telling everyone that I will be wiped out for about 5 days, then gradually coming back to normal over the following 2 weeks, I have actually felt "normal" for the last 8 days, keep taking the anti sickness drugs, my hospital gave me 5 days supply, but went back to docs as still feeling sick, took for about another 5 days then accidentally forgot to take one day and realised I felt ok. This is totally do able and I keep thinking about planning for my "I kicked cancers butt" party!! Good luck and hugs xoxo

Posts.Title: First docotexal

I have mentioned it at every appointment and been told not to be silly that they got wide enough margins and only 1 lymph node affected. BCN was useless and I haven't spoken to her since my op in oct. I will wait till Friday and hopefully the doctor at beatson will reassure me. Thanks for your reply and here's to 2014, Emma sorry for hijacking your post.. Best wishes to all xx
Posts.Title: First docotexal

Posts.Content: Hi stumble, isn't it so different from how we were before this awful disease chose to visit us.. I have had a lumpectomy and 2nd op for wider margins and to remove lymph nodes, so not going to apply for any topless waitress jobs! I started off at first very self conscious about my body and all the men that wanted to look and touch me, the turning point was when I went for my heart monitor check and I haven't been wearing a bra since my ops but it was all male nurses doing the checks and my nurse said if you can strip to your bra to allow him to place the sticky pads on me, don't know who was more embarrassed when he came behind curtain and I was topless.. I woke up with nightmares for about a week later.. I try now to think that they have seen loads of women like us and they probably don't even think about it.. Would it help for you to talk to one of the nurses on here or at a Maggie's centre or Macmillan drop in centre? My breast nurse was almost invisible too and I felt like a nuisance, your not in Glasgow by any chance? Good luck for rest of your treatment.. Xx
Posts.Title: I feel...violated?

Posts.Content: Good luck for today, you feel so much better when it is gone! Advise post op, do exercises, rest, let people help, eat what you like, do you have any other treatment after op? Good luck today..
Posts.Title: Op day at last...

Posts.Content: Mamasatch get back in touch with your health authority I had the same experience, no appt after 2 weeks and they didn't know when I would get appt. I rattled a few cages and had an appt scheduled within 2 days.. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: Me too grade 3 triple negative, one more chemo to go ...14th February! Happy valentines ðŸ’• can't wait to be finished and go for lovely slap up meal as soon as I get my taste back.. Good luck everyone xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer triple neg grad 3

Posts.Content: Hi. Absolutely do not wait, I had exactly same with my local hospital back in July, when I called after 2 weeks, was told they did not have appointment and didn't know when they would have !!! I then asked to speak to senior/manager and after much screaming and determination I had an appt at another hospital within Glasgow area.. That weekend.. I went for mammogram and biopsy and have had lump removed along with clear lymp nodes, I dread to think what would have happened if I didn't insist!! Don't take no for an answer, good luck and don't worry...
Posts.Title: mammogram ..??

Posts.Content: If I had my FEC before noon I was told to take at 6pm the same night, but if FEC after noon then nothing till morning following day, I also took 1 pill 3 times a day, just shows the difference, if you are in doubt call the hospital, you should have a contact number, best that you take to prevent sickness rather than taking after being sick.. Good luck.. X
Posts.Title: Dexamethasone following FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Wonder if anyone has experienced loss of period after surgery? Had period about 3 days after removal of lymph nodes following previous lumpectomy and sentinel node removal. All lymph nodes clear. This period was early and it's now about 6 weeks since last period, used to be regular 28 days cycle. Still to start chemo has had chest infection, but should be all go next Friday..
Posts.Title: Period has stopped

Posts.Content: Hi trudi, keep trying to look on bright side. Hope that periods stopping is permanent, I am 46 and def don't want any more kids.. Mine are 19 and 15 so getting my own life back.. Lol, apart from this horrible creature we are having to deal with right now.. I have found this site really useful and the nurses excellent to speak to, they explained so much more that what consultant/BCN.. Went to A&E last night as the pain and heartburn I was having was unbearable, turns out it was the anti biotics causing, it! Stopped them as doc said chest infection cleared up, feel so much better, hopefully start chemo this Friday, I had grade 3, however only needed lump removed, two ops to get clear margins and lymph nodes which only one positive on first op, none on 2nd. Let me know how you get on with your results.. Love & hugs Sharon

Posts.Title: The blue dye used in the Sentinel Lymph Node Bisopsy

Posts.Content: Hi, I found it depended on which chemo, on FEC I immediately felt rotten which lasted about 5/6 days then gradually started to feel better. The Taxotere was different, I felt ok for first 2/3 days then felt rotten for about 5 days.. It's not nice.. Do what your body tells you, sleep when you need to, eat what you want and watch daytime telly till that drives you insane, try to get out for walks when you can, it does help.. Good luck, I had my last chemo last Friday and I remember thinking after my first that I can't do this.. But I did!!
Posts.Title: after effects chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne I claimed on my policy, the small print stated that the cancer had to be invasive to be able to settle the claim, as my cancer was the claim was settled, all depends on policy, but go ahead you've nothing to lose.. It does feel weird having all that money and it means absolutely nothing to you, I used mine to pay off majority of mortgage which obviously helps financially.. Good luck..
Posts.Title: Critical illness claim

Posts.Content: I feel badly let down since my lumpectomy in August and then second op fir wider margins and lymph node clearance. Very good friends as I thought have visited twice, haven't even visited since I started my chemo, tell me I look amazing with no hair as they have seen pics on Facebook, tell me on the phone that my family won't starve when I'm not up to making meals, not to worry if house is a mess! I have a new friend that phones every day and calls round every odd day with cake, pot of soup, and thank god for mother in law who comes every Monday and cleans/irons.. You truly do find out who are your closest friends/family..

Posts.Title: Feeling rough at minute

Posts.Content: Hi I had similar experience by having lymph nodes removed on 27 august which were clear and yes have the numbness in my arm, it is gradually getting better, had terrible itch last week which no matter how I scratched I couldn't feel it.. Posts.Title: Chemo delayed

Posts.Content: Patricia I live just outside of paisley! There are days of feeling isolated and then days when you want to be isolated. The best thing I did was to join this website, you are no longer isolated and you can talk about anything. I would definitely go to the drop in centre, you will meet people either in the same situation or have been (and come out the other end). I went for the first time last week, I also spoke to a McMillan nurse there and she gave me loads of info eg Maggie's centre. The nurses that you can phone on here are fantastic too. I spent last Friday crying off and on all day but then was out for lunch/socialising on Saturday .. Craziest roller coaster I've ever been on :) Easier said than done but try not to worry, take inspiration from all the wonderful people on here that are ahead of us on their journeys.. Luv Sharon
Posts.Title: coping with diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi patriciab... I was diagnosed in July and feel it has been a long journey, if I can give you any advise, ask ask ask ask questions, the worst thing is not knowing and in my case I felt as though I was being a nuisance when talking to my surgeon and breast cancer nurse.. My salvation was speaking to the McMillan nurses, both here and at our local library drop in.. I continually question every little ache/pain, recently had flu and was convinced the cancer had spread to my lungs, anti biotics sorted that out. I am also getting flu jag next week. I start chemo next week and my biggest upset is losing my hair! I try to tell myself that :) all the other side effects will be dealt with if and when ! Use this forum, lots of ladies/men in here can help you through this.. Good luck and it's ok to have a break down every now and again.. Xxxx
